Package ePortfolio

Class MutualFund

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
ePortfolio.MutualFund
public class MutualFund extends Investment
This Represents a mutual fund investment, extending the general Investment class. Provides methods to manage mutual funds, including selling, updating book value, and calculating gains with a redemption fee for each sale.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class ePortfolio.Investment

    bookValue, name, price, quantity, realizedGain, symbol

    • MutualFund

      public MutualFund(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price)
      This initializes a MutualFund instance with the given symbol, name, quantity, and price.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The mutual fund's symbol.
      name - The mutual fund's name.
      quantity - The number of units held.
      price - The current price per unit.

  • Method Details

    • calculateInitialBookValue

      protected double calculateInitialBookValue(int quantity, double price)
      This calculates the initial book value when buying mutual funds (no additional fees).
      Specified by:
      calculateInitialBookValue in class Investment
      Parameters:
      quantity - The number of units bought.
      price - The price per unit.
      Returns:
      The calculated book value without additional fees.

    • sell

      public double sell(int quantity, double price)
      This sells a specified number of units at a given price and calculates the gain.
      Specified by:
      sell in class Investment
      Parameters:
      quantity - The number of units to sell.
      price - The price per unit for the sale.
      Returns:
      The gain from the sale as a double, or -1 if the sale is invalid.

    • updateBookValue

      public void updateBookValue(double price, int quantity)
      This updates the book value of the investment by adding the cost of additional units purchased at the specified price.
      Parameters:
      price - The price per unit at which the additional quantity was bought.
      quantity - The quantity of additional units bought.

    • reduceBookValue

      This reduces the book value proportionally when units are sold.

    • getGain

      public double getGain()
      This will Calculate the gain of the mutual fund investment based on the current quantity and price, subtracting the book value and the redemption fee.
